definition: to have the advantage overwhelmingly on one side/to support unconditionally
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
suffix of a noun of locality
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Which would make Barcelona's lopsided win even more impressive.
sentences.chinese: 巴塞罗那一边倒的胜利是令人心服口服的。

sentences.english: Measure from one side of the leg opening to the other side.
sentences.chinese: 测量从裤筒的一边倒另一边的宽度。

sentences.english: One-sided attitude of the international community, and have focused Libya's future.
sentences.chinese: 国际社会态度一边倒，并已经着眼利比亚的未来。

sentences.english: He is keeping in idea expensive infrequent facial wording and pouring one cup water.
sentences.chinese: 他一边留意着贵生的神情，一边倒了一杯水。

sentences.english: A one-sided gamble of inquiry, the beginner blade doubt to wantonly westerlo.
sentences.chinese: 一边倒的赌局中，新手刀锋毫无悬念地大肆败北。

sentences.english: Leaning to one side of back-nurture supply.
sentences.chinese: 二是反哺成本供给“一边倒”。

sentences.english: He had a bit more success against Ricky Hatton but still lost a one-sided decision.
sentences.chinese: 打哈顿时，他表现得更好些，但仍一边倒地输掉点数。

sentences.english: If the election is one-sided, it is really no contest.
sentences.chinese: 如果选举呈一边倒的局面，那么实际上毫无竞争可言。

sentences.english: Berto's one-sided victory over Juan Urango on Saturday night wasn't that.
sentences.chinese: 周六晚，贝托一边倒地赢了乌兰戈，但却不象那回事。

sentences.english: We're looking for a very one-sided fight.
sentences.chinese: 我们所寻求的是一边倒的战斗。

definition: to be entirely on one side/one-sided/lopsided/partisan/overwhelmingly on one side
public opinion
to denounce/to condemn
media/commentators
evenly matched (idiom)
to support (a cause)
to support/to back
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to attack (verbally or in writing)
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to crush or compact by means of a roller
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
farce/CL:場|场[chang3],齣|出[chu1],幕[mu4]
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
